intro: Myrsine insularis, commonly known as the island myrsine, is a shrub native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its flowers are white and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Myrsine insularis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils.
